# automaticallyEnablesStillImageStabilizationWhenAvailable

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether still image stabilization should be automatically enabled.

## Declaration

```swift
var automaticallyEnablesStillImageStabilizationWhenAvailable: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

If [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureStillImageOutput/isStillImageStabilizationSupported] returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], image stabilization may be applied to reduce blur commonly found in low light photos. When stabilization is enabled, still image captures incur additional latency.

The default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] when supported by the input device; otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

Setting this property throws an exception ([doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSExceptionName/invalidArgumentException]) if [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureStillImageOutput/isStillImageStabilizationSupported] returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Getting and setting image stabilization settings

- **isStillImageStabilizationActive**: Indicates whether still image stabilization is in use for the current capture.
- **isStillImageStabilizationSupported**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the  still image currently being captured supports still image stabilization.
